text: spurs to sign iceland u21 star tottenham are primed to snap up iceland under-21 international emil hallfredsson after he impressed on trial at white hart lane.  the 20-year-old midfielder  who plays for fh hafnarfjordur  also starred in the uefa cup match against scottish side dunfermline earlier this season. spurs have agreed a fee for the player  who has yet to agree personal terms.  he had offers from two other clubs but he decided to come to tottenham   said spurs sporting director frank arnesen.  he is a left-sided player  a position we have been looking at and he showed so much talent in his time here that we decided to take him.  it s down the road of bringing in talent  good prospects and giving them a place at tottenham where they can improve.

The spurs to sign iceland u21 star tottenham are first ready to break iceland under-21 international emil hallfredsson after he impressed in a trial with white hart lane. the 20-year-old midfielder who plays for fh hafnarfjordur also played in the cup match uefa against scottish side dunfermline earlier this season. spurons have accepted a prize for the player who has not yet accepted the personal terms. he had offers from two other clubs but he decided to come to tottenham said spurs sports director franc arnesen. he is a player on the left a position that we have been looking at and he has shown so much talent in his time here that we have decided to take it. it is on the way to bring good prospects of talent and to give them a place tottenham where they can improve.

dent continues adelaide progress american taylor dent reached the final of the australian hardcourt event in adelaide with a crushing 6-1 6-1 win over argentine juan ignacio chela.  dent will meet swede joachim johansson on sunday after the second seed survived a tense tie-break to defeat belgium s olivier rochus 6-1 7-6 (7/5). johansson  the boyfriend of lleyton hewitt s sister jaslyn  received strong crowd support on saturday.  it feels like home for me  because jaslyn lives here   said johansson. rochus was leading 5-4 in the second set tiebreak but his concentration was ruffled by a disputed line call and the match slipped away.  it was so close - one mistake like this and the match is over  it s tough. for me  it was clearly out   rochus said.

tent continued adelaide American progress taylor dent reached the final of the Australian hardcourt to adelaide race with an overwhelming 6-1 6-1 victory over the silver juan ignicio chela. dent will meet swede joachim johansson Sunday after the second seed survived a tie break strained to defeat belgium s olive rochus 6-1 7-6 (7/5). Johansson the boyfriend of lleyton hewitt s sister jaslyn received strong crowd support on Saturday. he feels like home because jaslyn lives here said johansson. rochus was in the lead 5-4 in the second set tiebreak but his concentration was stifled by a disputed online call and the match slipped. he was so close - a mistake like this and the match passed it's difficult. for me it was clearly off rochus said.

koubek suspended after drugs test stefan koubek says he has been banned for three months by the international tennis federation (itf) after testing positive for a banned substance.  the world number 60 failed a routine drugs test at this year s french open but now plans to lodge an appeal. koubek believes an injection given to him by an austrian doctor to treat a wrist injury is to blame for producing traces of the substance in his system.  i have acted correctly   the 27-year-old austrian said in a statement. koubek  who defeated britain s greg rusedski in the decisive rubber of the davis cup in september  is now set to miss the start of the season. he said   a three-month ban would mean that i not only will miss the australian open  but also the davis cup in australia.

everton s weir cools euro hopes everton defender david weir has played down talk of european football  despite his team lying in second place in the premiership after beating liverpool.  weir told bbc radio five live:  we don t want to rest on our laurels and say we have achieved anything yet.  i think you start taking your eye off the ball if you make statements and look too far into the future.  if you start making predictions you soon fall back into trouble. the only thing that matters is the next game.  he said:  we are looking after each other and hard work goes a long way in this league. we have definitely shown that.  also injuries and suspensions haven t cost us too badly and we have a lot of self-belief around the place.

everton s weir cools the euro hopes that the defender of everton david weir has played to talk about European football despite his team lying in second place in the firstship after beating liver pool. weir said bbc radio five live: we don't want to rest on our laurels and say that we have got anything yet. I think you start to take the eye off the ball if you make statements and look too far into the future. if you start making predictions you soon fall back into trouble. the only thing that matters is the next match. he said: we take care of each other and the hard work goes a long way in this league. we have certainly shown that. also injuries and suspensions didn't cost us too much and we have a lot of self-believe around the place.

ronaldo considering new contract manchester united winger cristiano ronaldo said he is close to agreeing to a new contract at old trafford.  the portugal star  who joined in august 2003 on a five-year-deal  is a regular in the united first-team.  the united board have already made an offer to renew the contract but i m trying not to think about it   he told the news of the world.  my agent has spoken with the club and it will be resolved soon. i think we ll reach a good agreement for both sides.  ronaldo refused to commit his long-term future to the club.   nobody knows what will come tomorrow. i like being here  but who knows   he added.  there aren t many bigger and better clubs than this one. it s my ambition to be at a big club. i m happy but nobody knows the future.

I like to be here but who knows that he added. there is not much bigger and better clubs than this one. it is my ambition to be in a great club. I am happy but no one knows the future.

pountney handed ban and fine northampton coach budge pountney has been fined Â£2 000 and banned from match-day coaching for six weeks for calling a referee  a disgrace .  pountney was found guilty of bringing the game into disrepute at a rugby football union disciplinary hearing in london on thursday night. pountney criticised referee steve lander s performance in northampton s defeat by saracens on 5 february. the last two weeks of the six-week ban are suspended. pountney pleaded guilty to the offence before a panel consisting of chairman robert horner  nigel gillingham and jeff probyn. the ban means former scotland international pountney cannot enter the playing enclosure  technical areas or go near the touchline  tunnel or players and officials  areas on the day of a game.

pountney was found guilty of having hated the game at a disciplinary hearing of the rugby football union in London on Thursday night. pountney criticized the referee Steve's performance in the defeat of Nordampton by saracens on February 5. the last two weeks of the six-week ban are suspended. pountney pleaded guilty to the offence before a jury composed of President Robert horner nigel gillingham and jeff probyn. the ban means that the former international Scotland pountney cannot enter the technical play areas or go near the touch tunnel or the areas of officials on the day of a match.

injury sidelines philippoussis mark philippoussis withdrew from the sydney international tennis tournament as expected on sunday after suffering a groin injury during the hopman cup.  his participation in the australian open  which begins on 17 january in melbourne  also remains in doubt. defending women s champion justine henin-hardenne is also out of the sydney event because of a knee injury. in the only main draw men s or women s singles match on sunday  nathalie dechy beat american lisa raymond 7-5 6-3. number one men s seed lleyton hewitt begins his quest for a fourth sydney title on tuesday when he plays karol beck. lindsay davenport  top seed in the women s draw  has been handed a first-round bye and plays france s dechy in the second round on tuesday.

Lindsay davenport seed top in the women's draw was awarded a first round set and play france sdechy in the second round on Tuesday.

pavey focuses on indoor success jo pavey will miss january s view from great edinburgh international cross country to focus on preparing for the european indoor championships in march.  the 31-year-old was third behind hayley yelling and justyna bak in last week s european cross country championships but she prefers to race on the track.  it was great winning bronze but i m wary of injuries and must concentrate on the indoor season   she said.  because of previous injuries i don t even run up hills in training.  pavey  who came fifth in the 5 000m at the athens olympics  helped the british cross country team win the team silver medal in heringsdorf last week. she is likely to start her 3 000m season with a race in either boston or stuttgart at the end of january.

soderling wins tense milan final fifth seed robin soderling took the milan indoors title with a dramatic win over radek stepanek in sunday s final.  the 20-year-old swede edged the final set tie-break for a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory and his second tour title after winning in lyon last year.  i m delighted to have won against such a good opponent in a tournament of this importance   said soderling.  i was really on form  my service was good and i really liked playing on the synthetic surface.  soderling  the world number 37  shrugged off a nervous start to take the opening set on his first set point. a change in approach from fourth seed stepanek in the second set paid dividends as he took it on a tie-break  but soderling s superior power proved too much in the third.

rusedski forced out in marseille greg rusedski was forced to withdraw from the open 13 in marseille on thursday with a rib injury.  the british number two had been scheduled to play qualifier sebastien de chaunac  who beat world number five guillermo coria 6-4 7-5 in round one. but rusedski was unable to take to the court because of a problem with the left-hand side of his rib-cage. american taylor dent caused a shock with a 7-6 6-2 victory over second seed david nalbandian. but third seed joachim johansson made it through after beating frenchman gilles simon 7-6 6-3 while in the first match of the day  sixth seed feliciano lopez defeated ivo karlovic. there were also wins for slovakia s karol beck and croatian duo ivan ljubicic and mario ancic.

rusedski forced to marseille greg rusedski was forced to withdraw from the opening 13 to marseille on Thursday with an injury to the coast. the British number two had been planned to play the Sebastian qualification of chaunac that beat the world number five guillermo coria 6-4 7-5 in round one. but rusedski was unable to take to the court due to a problem with the left side of his chest cage. taylor dent American caused a shock with a victory 7-6 6-2 on the second seed david nalbandian. but third seed joachim johansson succeeded after beating the French girls simon 7-6 6-3 while in the first match of the sixth day feliciano lopez defeated ivo karlovic. there were also victories for slovakia s karolbeck and croatian duo ivan ljubicicicicicicicic and mario anc.

curbishley delight for johansson charlton manager alan curbishley paid tribute to two-goal striker jonatan johansson after beating norwich.  curbishley said after the 4-0 win:  there was talk about norwich being interested in the summer but i have a lot of faith in jonatan.  when there was talk of other clubs i just told him he was going nowhere.  he s part of our squad and he got us a couple of important goals early on. i m sure he s happy here  but i was delighted with all the players.  curbishley was subjected to criticism from charlton fans recently  and he said:  the thing about this club is that we have got where we are by all pulling in the same direction.  that s happened for however long i ve been here and we don t want people taking sides.

He was told that he was part of our team and that he got us some important goals early. I'm sure he's happy here but I was delighted with all the players. I was recently criticized for charlton fans and he said: the thing about this club is that we all got there shooting in the same direction. that happened for so long I was here and we don't want people to take sides.

He was told that he was part of our team and that he got us some important goals early. I'm sure he's happy here but I was delighted with all the players. I was recently criticized for charlton fans and he said: the thing about this club is that we all got there shooting in the same direction. that happened for so long I was here and we don't want people to take sides.

He was told that he was part of our team and that he got us some important goals early. I'm sure he's happy here but I was delighted with all the players. I was recently criticized for charlton fans and he said: the thing about this club is that we all got there shooting in the same direction. that happened for so long I was here and we don't want people to take sides.

He was told that he was part of our team and that he got us some important goals early. I'm sure he's happy here but I was delighted with all the players. I was recently criticized for charlton fans and he said: the thing about this club is that we all got there shooting in the same direction. that happened for so long I was here and we don't want people to take sides.

everton s weir cools euro hopes everton defender david weir has played down talk of european football  despite his team lying in second place in the premiership after beating liverpool.  weir told bbc radio five live:  we don t want to rest on our laurels and say we have achieved anything yet.  i think you start taking your eye off the ball if you make statements and look too far into the future.  if you start making predictions you soon fall back into trouble. the only thing that matters is the next game.  he said:  we are looking after each other and hard work goes a long way in this league. we have definitely shown that.  also injuries and suspensions haven t cost us too badly and we have a lot of self-belief around the place.

everton s weir cools the euro hopes that the defender of everton david weir has played to talk about European football despite his team lying in second place in the firstship after beating liver pool. weir said bbc radio five live: we don't want to rest on our laurels and say that we have got anything yet. I think you start to take the eye off the ball if you make statements and look too far into the future. if you start making predictions you soon fall back into trouble. the only thing that matters is the next match. he said: we take care of each other and the hard work goes a long way in this league. we have certainly shown that. also injuries and suspensions didn't cost us too much and we have a lot of self-believe around the place.

ronaldo considering new contract manchester united winger cristiano ronaldo said he is close to agreeing to a new contract at old trafford.  the portugal star  who joined in august 2003 on a five-year-deal  is a regular in the united first-team.  the united board have already made an offer to renew the contract but i m trying not to think about it   he told the news of the world.  my agent has spoken with the club and it will be resolved soon. i think we ll reach a good agreement for both sides.  ronaldo refused to commit his long-term future to the club.   nobody knows what will come tomorrow. i like being here  but who knows   he added.  there aren t many bigger and better clubs than this one. it s my ambition to be at a big club. i m happy but nobody knows the future.

boro suffer morrison injury blow middlesbrough midfielder james morrison has been ruled out for up to eight weeks after an operation on tuesday.  the 18-year-old  who has played in 13 of the club s last 14 games  had surgery to repair a double hernia. a club spokesman confirmed:  it is a bilateral sportsman s hernia  which was operated on yesterday.  morrison was sent for scans after being substituted at half-time during boro s 2-1 uefa cup win over graz ak in which he scored the equaliser. his injury is the latest blow for the teessiders  who have been without gaizka mendieta  george boateng and mark viduka for extended periods. meanwhile  the kick-off time for boro s uefa cup match at sporting lisbon on 17 march has been brought forward from 2115 gmt to 1945 gmt.

boro suffer morrison wound mid-brough mid-field james morrison was excluded for up to eight weeks after an operation on Tuesday. the 18-year-old who played in 13 of the last 14 matches of the club had surgery to repair a double hernia. a spokesman of the club confirmed: it is a bilateral athlete hernia that was operated yesterday. morrison was sent for scans after having been substituted for half-time for boro s 2-1 uefa cup victory over the Ak graz in which he scored the equalization. his injury is the last blow for the tessers who were without gaizka mendieta george boateng and brand viduka for long periods.

soderling wins tense milan final fifth seed robin soderling took the milan indoors title with a dramatic win over radek stepanek in sunday s final.  the 20-year-old swede edged the final set tie-break for a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory and his second tour title after winning in lyon last year.  i m delighted to have won against such a good opponent in a tournament of this importance   said soderling.  i was really on form  my service was good and i really liked playing on the synthetic surface.  soderling  the world number 37  shrugged off a nervous start to take the opening set on his first set point. a change in approach from fourth seed stepanek in the second set paid dividends as he took it on a tie-break  but soderling s superior power proved too much in the third.

o sullivan commits to dublin race sonia o sullivan will seek to regain her title at the bupa great ireland run on 9 april in dublin.  the 35-year-old was beaten into fourth at last year s event  having won it a year earlier.  i understand she s had a solid winter s training down in australia after recovering from a minor injury   said race director matthew turnbull. mark carroll  irish record holder at 3km  5km and 10km  will make his debut in the mass participation 10km race. carroll has stepped up his form in recent weeks and in late january scored an impressive 3 000m victory over leading american alan webb in boston. carroll will be facing stiff competition from australian craig mottram  winner in dublin for the last two years.

o sullivan is committed to the dublin race sonia o sullivan will seek to regain her title at the bupa grand irland run on April 9 in dublin. the 35-year-old was beaten in fourth in last year's event having won a year earlier. I understand that she had a solid winter training in Australia after recovering from a minor injury known as race manager matthew turnbull. brand carroll record holder at 3km 5km and 10km will make her debut in the mass participation 10km race. carroll has intensified her form in recent weeks and at the end of January has scored an impressive 3,000m victory over the American leader alan webb in boston. carroll will face the harsh competition of the Australian craig mottram winner at dublin for the last two years.

dent continues adelaide progress american taylor dent reached the final of the australian hardcourt event in adelaide with a crushing 6-1 6-1 win over argentine juan ignacio chela.  dent will meet swede joachim johansson on sunday after the second seed survived a tense tie-break to defeat belgium s olivier rochus 6-1 7-6 (7/5). johansson  the boyfriend of lleyton hewitt s sister jaslyn  received strong crowd support on saturday.  it feels like home for me  because jaslyn lives here   said johansson. rochus was leading 5-4 in the second set tiebreak but his concentration was ruffled by a disputed line call and the match slipped away.  it was so close - one mistake like this and the match is over  it s tough. for me  it was clearly out   rochus said.

boro suffer morrison injury blow middlesbrough midfielder james morrison has been ruled out for up to eight weeks after an operation on tuesday.  the 18-year-old  who has played in 13 of the club s last 14 games  had surgery to repair a double hernia. a club spokesman confirmed:  it is a bilateral sportsman s hernia  which was operated on yesterday.  morrison was sent for scans after being substituted at half-time during boro s 2-1 uefa cup win over graz ak in which he scored the equaliser. his injury is the latest blow for the teessiders  who have been without gaizka mendieta  george boateng and mark viduka for extended periods. meanwhile  the kick-off time for boro s uefa cup match at sporting lisbon on 17 march has been brought forward from 2115 gmt to 1945 gmt.

boro suffer morrison wound mid-brough mid-field james morrison was excluded for up to eight weeks after an operation on Tuesday. the 18-year-old who played in 13 of the last 14 matches of the club had surgery to repair a double hernia. a spokesman of the club confirmed: it is a bilateral athlete hernia that was operated yesterday. morrison was sent for scans after having been substituted for half-time for boro s 2-1 uefa cup victory over the Ak graz in which he scored the equalization. his injury is the last blow for the tessers who were without gaizka mendieta george boateng and brand viduka for long periods.

ivanovic seals canberra victory serbia s ana ivanovic captured her first wta title with a straight-sets victory over hungarian melinda czink in the final of the canberra classic.  the 17-year-old took 83 minutes to take the match 7-5 6-1. ivanovic beat czink in the last round of qualifying but the hungarian made the main draw as a lucky loser after katarina srebotnik withdrew injured. ivanovic said:  i was really nervous in the beginning  but i pulled through and didn t do too much wrong.  a junior wimbledon finalist last year  she added:  it s my first wta title  and to win it has really given me more energy to practice and improve.  ivanovic will play 32nd seed iveta benesova of the czech republic in the first round.said of the australian open in melbourne.

ivanovic seal canberra victory serbia s ana ivanovic captured his first wta title with a direct victory over the Hungarian melinda czink in the final of the classic canberra. the 17-year-old took 83 minutes to take the game 7-5 6-1. ivanovic beat czink in the last qualifying round but the Hungarian made the main draw as a lucky loser after katarina srebotnik withdrew injured. ivanovic said: I was really nervous at first but I pulled through and didn't hurt too much. a junior finalist wimbledon last year she added: this is my first wta title and winning it really gave me more energy to practice and improve. ivanovic will play 32nd see iveta benesova of the Czech Republic in the first round.Said of the Australian opened in melbourne.

soderling wins tense milan final fifth seed robin soderling took the milan indoors title with a dramatic win over radek stepanek in sunday s final.  the 20-year-old swede edged the final set tie-break for a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory and his second tour title after winning in lyon last year.  i m delighted to have won against such a good opponent in a tournament of this importance   said soderling.  i was really on form  my service was good and i really liked playing on the synthetic surface.  soderling  the world number 37  shrugged off a nervous start to take the opening set on his first set point. a change in approach from fourth seed stepanek in the second set paid dividends as he took it on a tie-break  but soderling s superior power proved too much in the third.

johnson too strong for gb runners britain s kathy butler and hayley yelling were no match for benita johnson in the 51st cross international zornotza in amorebieta  spain.  butler and yelling finished fourth and fifth as australian world champion johnson romped to a five-second victory in the 6km race ahead of edith masai. masai s fellow kenyan alice timbilil finished third. johnson said:  i ran comfortably for the first 3km and then i tried to leave the others but it wasn t an easy task.  butler clocked a time of 22 minutes 45 seconds - 22secs behind the winner but four ahead of yelling  who last month succeeded paula radcliffe as european champion. johnson  will be one of the star attractions at the great edinburghinternational cross country on 15 january.

Johnson too strong for runners gb brita s kathy butler and screaming hayley were not the match for benita johnson in the 51st international race zornotza in amorebieta spain. Majorer and screaming finished fourth and fifth as Australian world champion johnson jumped to a five-second win in the 6km race ahead of Edith masai. masai his colleague kenyan alice timbil finished third. Johnson said: I ran comfortably for the first 3 km and then I tried to leave the others but it was not an easy task. Majorer took a time of 22 minutes 45 seconds - 22 seconds behind the winner but four seconds before yelling who succeeded last month paula radcliffe as European champion. Johnson will be one of the star attractions in the big country Edinburghinternational cross on January 15th.

ronaldo considering new contract manchester united winger cristiano ronaldo said he is close to agreeing to a new contract at old trafford.  the portugal star  who joined in august 2003 on a five-year-deal  is a regular in the united first-team.  the united board have already made an offer to renew the contract but i m trying not to think about it   he told the news of the world.  my agent has spoken with the club and it will be resolved soon. i think we ll reach a good agreement for both sides.  ronaldo refused to commit his long-term future to the club.   nobody knows what will come tomorrow. i like being here  but who knows   he added.  there aren t many bigger and better clubs than this one. it s my ambition to be at a big club. i m happy but nobody knows the future.

beattie return calms attack fears everton striker james beattie has been declared fit for training on tuesday  despite suffering an alleged assault last saturday.  beattie  27  is not believed to be as seriously hurt as some reports have suggested after being  the victim of an unprovoked assault  in birmingham. he was on a night out with his girlfriend and two friends following everton s 3-1 win over aston villa.  he was shaken but not badly injured   said everton spokesman ian ross. he added:  he did speak to the police but will not be pressing charges.  he has spoken to manager david moyes about what happened.  beattie was suspended for the win at aston villa after his red card against chelsea and he will be available again for the merseyside derby at liverpool on 20 march.

Beattie return calm the attack fears Everton attacking james Beattie was declared fit for training on Tuesday despite the suffering of an alleged assault last Saturday. beattie 27 is not believed to be as seriously injured as some reports suggested after being the victim of an unprovoked assault in Birmingham. he was on one night with his girlfriend and two friends after Everton s 3-1 victory over the villa in Aston. he was shaken but not seriously injured said Everton spokesman ian ross. he added: he spoke to the police but will not file a complaint. he spoke to manager David Moyes about what happened. beattie was suspended for the victory at Aston villa after his red card against chelsea and he will be available again for the merseyside derby liver on March 20.

o sullivan commits to dublin race sonia o sullivan will seek to regain her title at the bupa great ireland run on 9 april in dublin.  the 35-year-old was beaten into fourth at last year s event  having won it a year earlier.  i understand she s had a solid winter s training down in australia after recovering from a minor injury   said race director matthew turnbull. mark carroll  irish record holder at 3km  5km and 10km  will make his debut in the mass participation 10km race. carroll has stepped up his form in recent weeks and in late january scored an impressive 3 000m victory over leading american alan webb in boston. carroll will be facing stiff competition from australian craig mottram  winner in dublin for the last two years.

tottenham bid £8m for forest duo nottingham forest have confirmed they have received an Â£8m bid from tottenham for andy reid and michael dawson.  reid rejected a move to southampton after forest accepted a cash-plus-players offer while spurs had made previous bids for the 22-year-old. spurs had also made an undisclosed offer for 21-year-old defender dawson. forest chief executive mark arthur said:  we ve received an Â£8m bid from spurs for the two players and we re considering the offer.  southampton s offer for republic of ireland international reid comprised Â£3m-plus and two players - brett ormerod and darren kenton.  spurs had seen previous bids of Â£3m  Â£4m and Â£5m for reid rejected by the championship club.

capriati to miss melbourne jennifer capriati has become the third leading lady to withdraw from the australian open because of injury.  the organisers of the first grand slam of 2005  which begins on 17 january  said the american has a problem with her right shoulder. it comes as a blow to the women s draw as last year s champion  justin henin-hardenne  and runner-up  kim clijsters  will also be absent. capriati is a two-time champion in melbourne with wins in 2001 and 2002. she is believed to have picked up the injury at the advanta championships at philadelphia in november and had to pull out of an exhibition match with wimbledon champion maria sharapova on 17 december. capriati also decided against competing in the australian open warm-up event  the sydney international.

koubek suspended after drugs test stefan koubek says he has been banned for three months by the international tennis federation (itf) after testing positive for a banned substance.  the world number 60 failed a routine drugs test at this year s french open but now plans to lodge an appeal. koubek believes an injection given to him by an austrian doctor to treat a wrist injury is to blame for producing traces of the substance in his system.  i have acted correctly   the 27-year-old austrian said in a statement. koubek  who defeated britain s greg rusedski in the decisive rubber of the davis cup in september  is now set to miss the start of the season. he said   a three-month ban would mean that i not only will miss the australian open  but also the davis cup in australia.

newcastle line up babayaro newcastle manager graeme souness is closing in on signing chelsea defender celestine babayaro when the transfer window reopens.  souness is bidding to bolster his defence and  according to reports  contract negotiations are at an advanced stage with the player. babayaro has been in the premiership since 1997 when he moved to chelsea for Â£2.25m from anderlecht. but the 26-year-old has been surplus to requirements this season. souness would not be drawn on specifics over individual players.  but he said:  all i can tell you is that the chairman has worked really hard in the last couple of months to try to do deals.  we have said from day one we want to strengthen  and that is what we are hoping to do in the coming weeks.

beattie return calms attack fears everton striker james beattie has been declared fit for training on tuesday  despite suffering an alleged assault last saturday.  beattie  27  is not believed to be as seriously hurt as some reports have suggested after being  the victim of an unprovoked assault  in birmingham. he was on a night out with his girlfriend and two friends following everton s 3-1 win over aston villa.  he was shaken but not badly injured   said everton spokesman ian ross. he added:  he did speak to the police but will not be pressing charges.  he has spoken to manager david moyes about what happened.  beattie was suspended for the win at aston villa after his red card against chelsea and he will be available again for the merseyside derby at liverpool on 20 march.

Beattie return calm the attack fears Everton attacking james Beattie was declared fit for training on Tuesday despite the suffering of an alleged assault last Saturday. beattie 27 is not believed to be as seriously injured as some reports suggested after being the victim of an unprovoked assault in Birmingham. he was on one night with his girlfriend and two friends after Everton s 3-1 victory over the villa in Aston. he was shaken but not seriously injured said Everton spokesman ian ross. he added: he spoke to the police but will not file a complaint. he spoke to manager David Moyes about what happened. beattie was suspended for the victory at Aston villa after his red card against chelsea and he will be available again for the merseyside derby liver on March 20.

tulu to appear at caledonian run two-time olympic 10 000 metres champion derartu tulu has confirmed she will take part in the bupa great caledonian run in edinburgh on 8 may.  the 32-year-old ethiopian is the first star name to enter the event. tulu has won the boston  london and tokyo marathons  as well as the world 10 000m title in 2001.  we are delighted to have secured the services of one the most decorated competitors the sport has ever seen   said race director matthew turnbull.  her record speaks for herself and there are few other women distance runners who would dare compare their pedigree with tulu s   he added.  she might be 33 next month  but that didn t stop her winning the olympic 10 000m bronze medal last summer. she s an ultra-consistent championships racer.

Tulu has confirmed that she will take part in the big Caledonian race in Edinburgh on May 8th. the 32-year-old Ethiopian is the first star name to take part in the event. tulu won the Boston marathons London and Tokyo as well as the world title of 10,000m in 2001. We are delighted to have obtained the services of one of the most decorated competitors that sport has ever seen the race director matthew Turnbull say. her record speaks for herself and there are few other distance runners who would dare compare their pedigree with tulu if he added. she could be 33 next month but that did not prevent her from winning the Olympic bronze medal of 10,000m last summer. she is an ultra-constant runner in the championships.

ivanovic seals canberra victory serbia s ana ivanovic captured her first wta title with a straight-sets victory over hungarian melinda czink in the final of the canberra classic.  the 17-year-old took 83 minutes to take the match 7-5 6-1. ivanovic beat czink in the last round of qualifying but the hungarian made the main draw as a lucky loser after katarina srebotnik withdrew injured. ivanovic said:  i was really nervous in the beginning  but i pulled through and didn t do too much wrong.  a junior wimbledon finalist last year  she added:  it s my first wta title  and to win it has really given me more energy to practice and improve.  ivanovic will play 32nd seed iveta benesova of the czech republic in the first round.said of the australian open in melbourne.

ivanovic seal canberra victory serbia s ana ivanovic captured his first wta title with a direct victory over the Hungarian melinda czink in the final of the classic canberra. the 17-year-old took 83 minutes to take the game 7-5 6-1. ivanovic beat czink in the last qualifying round but the Hungarian made the main draw as a lucky loser after katarina srebotnik withdrew injured. ivanovic said: I was really nervous at first but I pulled through and didn't hurt too much. a junior finalist wimbledon last year she added: this is my first wta title and winning it really gave me more energy to practice and improve. ivanovic will play 32nd see iveta benesova of the Czech Republic in the first round.Said of the Australian opened in melbourne.

rusedski forced out in marseille greg rusedski was forced to withdraw from the open 13 in marseille on thursday with a rib injury.  the british number two had been scheduled to play qualifier sebastien de chaunac  who beat world number five guillermo coria 6-4 7-5 in round one. but rusedski was unable to take to the court because of a problem with the left-hand side of his rib-cage. american taylor dent caused a shock with a 7-6 6-2 victory over second seed david nalbandian. but third seed joachim johansson made it through after beating frenchman gilles simon 7-6 6-3 while in the first match of the day  sixth seed feliciano lopez defeated ivo karlovic. there were also wins for slovakia s karol beck and croatian duo ivan ljubicic and mario ancic.

koubek suspended after drugs test stefan koubek says he has been banned for three months by the international tennis federation (itf) after testing positive for a banned substance.  the world number 60 failed a routine drugs test at this year s french open but now plans to lodge an appeal. koubek believes an injection given to him by an austrian doctor to treat a wrist injury is to blame for producing traces of the substance in his system.  i have acted correctly   the 27-year-old austrian said in a statement. koubek  who defeated britain s greg rusedski in the decisive rubber of the davis cup in september  is now set to miss the start of the season. he said   a three-month ban would mean that i not only will miss the australian open  but also the davis cup in australia.

tulu to appear at caledonian run two-time olympic 10 000 metres champion derartu tulu has confirmed she will take part in the bupa great caledonian run in edinburgh on 8 may.  the 32-year-old ethiopian is the first star name to enter the event. tulu has won the boston  london and tokyo marathons  as well as the world 10 000m title in 2001.  we are delighted to have secured the services of one the most decorated competitors the sport has ever seen   said race director matthew turnbull.  her record speaks for herself and there are few other women distance runners who would dare compare their pedigree with tulu s   he added.  she might be 33 next month  but that didn t stop her winning the olympic 10 000m bronze medal last summer. she s an ultra-consistent championships racer.

blunkett hints at election call ex-home secretary david blunkett has given fresh clues that the general election will be announced on monday.  he told bbc radio five live:  i m out in my constituency getting ready for what we presume will be an announcement very shortly at the weekend.  he clarified that he meant he would be in his sheffield seat this weekend  not that he expected an election call then. tony blair is tipped to ask the queen on monday to dissolve parliament ready for a 5 may poll.

blunkett gave new clues that the general election will be announced on Monday. he told bbc radio five live: I'm in my constituency preparing for what we assume will be an announcement very soon on the weekend. he said he wanted to say that he would be in his headquarters in Sheffield this weekend not that he expected an election call then. tony bair is advised to ask the queen on Monday to dissolve the parliament ready for a May 5 ballot.

robben plays down european return injured chelsea winger arjen robben has insisted that he only has a 10% chance of making a return against barcelona in the champions league.  the 21-year-old has been sidelined since breaking a foot against blackburn last month. chelsea face barcelona at home on 8 march having lost 2-1 in the first leg. and robben told the daily star:  it is not impossible that i will play against barcelona but it is just a very  very small chance - about 10%.   robben has been an inspirational player for chelsea this season following a switch from psv einhoven last summer. he added:  my recovery is going better than we expected a few weeks ago but i think the barcelona game will come too soon.  i won t take any risks and come back too soon.

tottenham bid £8m for forest duo nottingham forest have confirmed they have received an Â£8m bid from tottenham for andy reid and michael dawson.  reid rejected a move to southampton after forest accepted a cash-plus-players offer while spurs had made previous bids for the 22-year-old. spurs had also made an undisclosed offer for 21-year-old defender dawson. forest chief executive mark arthur said:  we ve received an Â£8m bid from spurs for the two players and we re considering the offer.  southampton s offer for republic of ireland international reid comprised Â£3m-plus and two players - brett ormerod and darren kenton.  spurs had seen previous bids of Â£3m  Â£4m and Â£5m for reid rejected by the championship club.

injury sidelines philippoussis mark philippoussis withdrew from the sydney international tennis tournament as expected on sunday after suffering a groin injury during the hopman cup.  his participation in the australian open  which begins on 17 january in melbourne  also remains in doubt. defending women s champion justine henin-hardenne is also out of the sydney event because of a knee injury. in the only main draw men s or women s singles match on sunday  nathalie dechy beat american lisa raymond 7-5 6-3. number one men s seed lleyton hewitt begins his quest for a fourth sydney title on tuesday when he plays karol beck. lindsay davenport  top seed in the women s draw  has been handed a first-round bye and plays france s dechy in the second round on tuesday.

soderling wins tense milan final fifth seed robin soderling took the milan indoors title with a dramatic win over radek stepanek in sunday s final.  the 20-year-old swede edged the final set tie-break for a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory and his second tour title after winning in lyon last year.  i m delighted to have won against such a good opponent in a tournament of this importance   said soderling.  i was really on form  my service was good and i really liked playing on the synthetic surface.  soderling  the world number 37  shrugged off a nervous start to take the opening set on his first set point. a change in approach from fourth seed stepanek in the second set paid dividends as he took it on a tie-break  but soderling s superior power proved too much in the third.

boro suffer morrison injury blow middlesbrough midfielder james morrison has been ruled out for up to eight weeks after an operation on tuesday.  the 18-year-old  who has played in 13 of the club s last 14 games  had surgery to repair a double hernia. a club spokesman confirmed:  it is a bilateral sportsman s hernia  which was operated on yesterday.  morrison was sent for scans after being substituted at half-time during boro s 2-1 uefa cup win over graz ak in which he scored the equaliser. his injury is the latest blow for the teessiders  who have been without gaizka mendieta  george boateng and mark viduka for extended periods. meanwhile  the kick-off time for boro s uefa cup match at sporting lisbon on 17 march has been brought forward from 2115 gmt to 1945 gmt.

boro suffer morrison wound mid-brough mid-field james morrison was excluded for up to eight weeks after an operation on Tuesday. the 18-year-old who played in 13 of the last 14 matches of the club had surgery to repair a double hernia. a spokesman of the club confirmed: it is a bilateral athlete hernia that was operated yesterday. morrison was sent for scans after having been substituted for half-time for boro s 2-1 uefa cup victory over the Ak graz in which he scored the equalization. his injury is the last blow for the tessers who were without gaizka mendieta george boateng and brand viduka for long periods.

soderling wins tense milan final fifth seed robin soderling took the milan indoors title with a dramatic win over radek stepanek in sunday s final.  the 20-year-old swede edged the final set tie-break for a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory and his second tour title after winning in lyon last year.  i m delighted to have won against such a good opponent in a tournament of this importance   said soderling.  i was really on form  my service was good and i really liked playing on the synthetic surface.  soderling  the world number 37  shrugged off a nervous start to take the opening set on his first set point. a change in approach from fourth seed stepanek in the second set paid dividends as he took it on a tie-break  but soderling s superior power proved too much in the third.

sederling wins the finale milan 5e seed robin sodering took the title milan indoor with a dramatic victory over radek stepanek in the finale of Sunday. the 20-year-old swede lined up the final tie-break set for a win 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) and his second lap title after winning in lyon last year. i am delighted to have won against such a good opponent in a tournament of this importance said sodering. I was really on the form my service was good and I really liked playing on the synthetic surface. sederling the world number 37 ruled out a nervous start to take the first set on his first set. a shift of approach of fourth seen stepanek in the second set paid dividends as he took it on a seed-break but s balancerling s superior could prove too much in the third set.

pavey focuses on indoor success jo pavey will miss january s view from great edinburgh international cross country to focus on preparing for the european indoor championships in march.  the 31-year-old was third behind hayley yelling and justyna bak in last week s european cross country championships but she prefers to race on the track.  it was great winning bronze but i m wary of injuries and must concentrate on the indoor season   she said.  because of previous injuries i don t even run up hills in training.  pavey  who came fifth in the 5 000m at the athens olympics  helped the british cross country team win the team silver medal in heringsdorf last week. she is likely to start her 3 000m season with a race in either boston or stuttgart at the end of january.

paver concentrates on the indoor success jo pavera will miss the January view of the great edinburgh international cross country to focus on preparing for the European indoor championships in March. the 31-year-old was third behind hayley screaming and justyna Bak in last week's European cross country championships but she prefers to run on the track. it was a great bronze victory but I trust the injuries and must focus on the inner season said. because of the previous injuries I did not even climb hills in training. paver who came fifth in the 5,000m at the athens olympics helped the British cross country team win the team silver medal in hingsdorf last week. she is likely to start her 3,000m season with a race in boston or stuttgart at the end of January.

injury sidelines philippoussis mark philippoussis withdrew from the sydney international tennis tournament as expected on sunday after suffering a groin injury during the hopman cup.  his participation in the australian open  which begins on 17 january in melbourne  also remains in doubt. defending women s champion justine henin-hardenne is also out of the sydney event because of a knee injury. in the only main draw men s or women s singles match on sunday  nathalie dechy beat american lisa raymond 7-5 6-3. number one men s seed lleyton hewitt begins his quest for a fourth sydney title on tuesday when he plays karol beck. lindsay davenport  top seed in the women s draw  has been handed a first-round bye and plays france s dechy in the second round on tuesday.

Philippous side injury philippous marks removed from the international sydney tennis tournament as expected on Sunday after having suffered a groin injury during the hops cup. his participation in the Australian opening that starts on January 17 in melbourne also remains in doubt. defending the women champions Justine henin-hardenne is also out of the sydney event due to a knee injury. in the only single game of men or women main draw on Sunday nathalie dechy beat American lisa raymond 7-5 6-3. number a man s seed lleyton hewitt starts his quest for a fourth sydney title on Tuesday when he plays karol eck. Lindsay davenport seed top in the women's draw was awarded a first round set and play france sdechy in the second round on Tuesday.

spurs to sign iceland u21 star tottenham are primed to snap up iceland under-21 international emil hallfredsson after he impressed on trial at white hart lane.  the 20-year-old midfielder  who plays for fh hafnarfjordur  also starred in the uefa cup match against scottish side dunfermline earlier this season. spurs have agreed a fee for the player  who has yet to agree personal terms.  he had offers from two other clubs but he decided to come to tottenham   said spurs sporting director frank arnesen.  he is a left-sided player  a position we have been looking at and he showed so much talent in his time here that we decided to take him.  it s down the road of bringing in talent  good prospects and giving them a place at tottenham where they can improve.

The spurs to sign iceland u21 star tottenham are first ready to break iceland under-21 international emil hallfredsson after he impressed in a trial with white hart lane. the 20-year-old midfielder who plays for fh hafnarfjordur also played in the cup match uefa against scottish side dunfermline earlier this season. spurons have accepted a prize for the player who has not yet accepted the personal terms. he had offers from two other clubs but he decided to come to tottenham said spurs sports director franc arnesen. he is a player on the left a position that we have been looking at and he has shown so much talent in his time here that we have decided to take it. it is on the way to bring good prospects of talent and to give them a place tottenham where they can improve.

tottenham bid £8m for forest duo nottingham forest have confirmed they have received an Â£8m bid from tottenham for andy reid and michael dawson.  reid rejected a move to southampton after forest accepted a cash-plus-players offer while spurs had made previous bids for the 22-year-old. spurs had also made an undisclosed offer for 21-year-old defender dawson. forest chief executive mark arthur said:  we ve received an Â£8m bid from spurs for the two players and we re considering the offer.  southampton s offer for republic of ireland international reid comprised Â£3m-plus and two players - brett ormerod and darren kenton.  spurs had seen previous bids of Â£3m  Â£4m and Â£5m for reid rejected by the championship club.

Tottenham bid £8m for the forest duo Nottingham forest confirmed that they received an offer of 8 million pounds of tottenham for andy Reid and michael dawson. Reid rejected a move to Southampton after the forest accepted an offer of more cash players while the spurs had made previous offers for the 22 years. spurs had also made an undisclosed offer for the defender of 21 years dawson. leader of the forest Mark arthur said: we received an offer of 8 million pounds of epis for the two players and we reconsider the offer. Southampton's offer for the republic of Ireland international Reid included Â£3m-plus and two players - Brett ormerod and Darren Kenton. spurons had seen previous offers of 3 million pounds 4 million and Â£5m for Reid rejected by the championship club.

johnson too strong for gb runners britain s kathy butler and hayley yelling were no match for benita johnson in the 51st cross international zornotza in amorebieta  spain.  butler and yelling finished fourth and fifth as australian world champion johnson romped to a five-second victory in the 6km race ahead of edith masai. masai s fellow kenyan alice timbilil finished third. johnson said:  i ran comfortably for the first 3km and then i tried to leave the others but it wasn t an easy task.  butler clocked a time of 22 minutes 45 seconds - 22secs behind the winner but four ahead of yelling  who last month succeeded paula radcliffe as european champion. johnson  will be one of the star attractions at the great edinburghinternational cross country on 15 january.

Johnson too strong for runners gb brita s kathy butler and screaming hayley were not the match for benita johnson in the 51st international race zornotza in amorebieta spain. Majorer and screaming finished fourth and fifth as Australian world champion johnson jumped to a five-second win in the 6km race ahead of Edith masai. masai his colleague kenyan alice timbil finished third. Johnson said: I ran comfortably for the first 3 km and then I tried to leave the others but it was not an easy task. Majorer took a time of 22 minutes 45 seconds - 22 seconds behind the winner but four seconds before yelling who succeeded last month paula radcliffe as European champion. Johnson will be one of the star attractions in the big country Edinburghinternational cross on January 15th.

tottenham bid £8m for forest duo nottingham forest have confirmed they have received an Â£8m bid from tottenham for andy reid and michael dawson.  reid rejected a move to southampton after forest accepted a cash-plus-players offer while spurs had made previous bids for the 22-year-old. spurs had also made an undisclosed offer for 21-year-old defender dawson. forest chief executive mark arthur said:  we ve received an Â£8m bid from spurs for the two players and we re considering the offer.  southampton s offer for republic of ireland international reid comprised Â£3m-plus and two players - brett ormerod and darren kenton.  spurs had seen previous bids of Â£3m  Â£4m and Â£5m for reid rejected by the championship club.

tulu to appear at caledonian run two-time olympic 10 000 metres champion derartu tulu has confirmed she will take part in the bupa great caledonian run in edinburgh on 8 may.  the 32-year-old ethiopian is the first star name to enter the event. tulu has won the boston  london and tokyo marathons  as well as the world 10 000m title in 2001.  we are delighted to have secured the services of one the most decorated competitors the sport has ever seen   said race director matthew turnbull.  her record speaks for herself and there are few other women distance runners who would dare compare their pedigree with tulu s   he added.  she might be 33 next month  but that didn t stop her winning the olympic 10 000m bronze medal last summer. she s an ultra-consistent championships racer.

Tulu has confirmed that she will take part in the big Caledonian race in Edinburgh on May 8th. the 32-year-old Ethiopian is the first star name to take part in the event. tulu won the Boston marathons London and Tokyo as well as the world title of 10,000m in 2001. We are delighted to have obtained the services of one of the most decorated competitors that sport has ever seen the race director matthew Turnbull say. her record speaks for herself and there are few other distance runners who would dare compare their pedigree with tulu if he added. she could be 33 next month but that did not prevent her from winning the Olympic bronze medal of 10,000m last summer. she is an ultra-constant runner in the championships.

solskjaer raises hopes of return manchester united striker ole gunnar solskjaer said he hoped to return next season following a career-threatening injury to his right knee.  the 31-year-old norway international had surgery in sweden in august to transplant cartilage into the joint.  i m in no doubt that i ll play again   solskjaer told aftenposten daily.  the problem will be the speed but we re talking about eight months  time. it s going as it should with the knee. i m slavishly following a programme.  solskjaer last played for united as a late substitute in may s fa cup final win over millwall. his contract with united runs out in 2006  by which time he will have been at the premier league club for 10 years.

soderling wins tense milan final fifth seed robin soderling took the milan indoors title with a dramatic win over radek stepanek in sunday s final.  the 20-year-old swede edged the final set tie-break for a 6-3 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-5) victory and his second tour title after winning in lyon last year.  i m delighted to have won against such a good opponent in a tournament of this importance   said soderling.  i was really on form  my service was good and i really liked playing on the synthetic surface.  soderling  the world number 37  shrugged off a nervous start to take the opening set on his first set point. a change in approach from fourth seed stepanek in the second set paid dividends as he took it on a tie-break  but soderling s superior power proved too much in the third.

everton s weir cools euro hopes everton defender david weir has played down talk of european football  despite his team lying in second place in the premiership after beating liverpool.  weir told bbc radio five live:  we don t want to rest on our laurels and say we have achieved anything yet.  i think you start taking your eye off the ball if you make statements and look too far into the future.  if you start making predictions you soon fall back into trouble. the only thing that matters is the next game.  he said:  we are looking after each other and hard work goes a long way in this league. we have definitely shown that.  also injuries and suspensions haven t cost us too badly and we have a lot of self-belief around the place.

pavey focuses on indoor success jo pavey will miss january s view from great edinburgh international cross country to focus on preparing for the european indoor championships in march.  the 31-year-old was third behind hayley yelling and justyna bak in last week s european cross country championships but she prefers to race on the track.  it was great winning bronze but i m wary of injuries and must concentrate on the indoor season   she said.  because of previous injuries i don t even run up hills in training.  pavey  who came fifth in the 5 000m at the athens olympics  helped the british cross country team win the team silver medal in heringsdorf last week. she is likely to start her 3 000m season with a race in either boston or stuttgart at the end of january.

koubek suspended after drugs test stefan koubek says he has been banned for three months by the international tennis federation (itf) after testing positive for a banned substance.  the world number 60 failed a routine drugs test at this year s french open but now plans to lodge an appeal. koubek believes an injection given to him by an austrian doctor to treat a wrist injury is to blame for producing traces of the substance in his system.  i have acted correctly   the 27-year-old austrian said in a statement. koubek  who defeated britain s greg rusedski in the decisive rubber of the davis cup in september  is now set to miss the start of the season. he said   a three-month ban would mean that i not only will miss the australian open  but also the davis cup in australia.

newcastle line up babayaro newcastle manager graeme souness is closing in on signing chelsea defender celestine babayaro when the transfer window reopens.  souness is bidding to bolster his defence and  according to reports  contract negotiations are at an advanced stage with the player. babayaro has been in the premiership since 1997 when he moved to chelsea for Â£2.25m from anderlecht. but the 26-year-old has been surplus to requirements this season. souness would not be drawn on specifics over individual players.  but he said:  all i can tell you is that the chairman has worked really hard in the last couple of months to try to do deals.  we have said from day one we want to strengthen  and that is what we are hoping to do in the coming weeks.

veteran martinez wins thai title conchita martinez won her first title in almost five years with victory over anna-lena groenefeld at the volvo women s open in pattaya  thailand.  the 32-year-old spaniard came through 6-3 3-6 6-3 for her first title since berlin in 2000.  it feels really good   said martinez  who is playing her last season on the tour.  to come through like that in an important match feels good.  it s been nearly five years and i didn t think i could do it.  groenefeld was the more powerful player but could not match her opponent s relentless accuracy.  it was my first final  a new experience   said the german.  i think she played a good match  a tough match  but i tried to stay in there. i think the whole week was good for me.

o sullivan commits to dublin race sonia o sullivan will seek to regain her title at the bupa great ireland run on 9 april in dublin.  the 35-year-old was beaten into fourth at last year s event  having won it a year earlier.  i understand she s had a solid winter s training down in australia after recovering from a minor injury   said race director matthew turnbull. mark carroll  irish record holder at 3km  5km and 10km  will make his debut in the mass participation 10km race. carroll has stepped up his form in recent weeks and in late january scored an impressive 3 000m victory over leading american alan webb in boston. carroll will be facing stiff competition from australian craig mottram  winner in dublin for the last two years.

injury sidelines philippoussis mark philippoussis withdrew from the sydney international tennis tournament as expected on sunday after suffering a groin injury during the hopman cup.  his participation in the australian open  which begins on 17 january in melbourne  also remains in doubt. defending women s champion justine henin-hardenne is also out of the sydney event because of a knee injury. in the only main draw men s or women s singles match on sunday  nathalie dechy beat american lisa raymond 7-5 6-3. number one men s seed lleyton hewitt begins his quest for a fourth sydney title on tuesday when he plays karol beck. lindsay davenport  top seed in the women s draw  has been handed a first-round bye and plays france s dechy in the second round on tuesday.

ronaldo considering new contract manchester united winger cristiano ronaldo said he is close to agreeing to a new contract at old trafford.  the portugal star  who joined in august 2003 on a five-year-deal  is a regular in the united first-team.  the united board have already made an offer to renew the contract but i m trying not to think about it   he told the news of the world.  my agent has spoken with the club and it will be resolved soon. i think we ll reach a good agreement for both sides.  ronaldo refused to commit his long-term future to the club.   nobody knows what will come tomorrow. i like being here  but who knows   he added.  there aren t many bigger and better clubs than this one. it s my ambition to be at a big club. i m happy but nobody knows the future.

everton s weir cools euro hopes everton defender david weir has played down talk of european football  despite his team lying in second place in the premiership after beating liverpool.  weir told bbc radio five live:  we don t want to rest on our laurels and say we have achieved anything yet.  i think you start taking your eye off the ball if you make statements and look too far into the future.  if you start making predictions you soon fall back into trouble. the only thing that matters is the next game.  he said:  we are looking after each other and hard work goes a long way in this league. we have definitely shown that.  also injuries and suspensions haven t cost us too badly and we have a lot of self-belief around the place.

capriati to miss melbourne jennifer capriati has become the third leading lady to withdraw from the australian open because of injury.  the organisers of the first grand slam of 2005  which begins on 17 january  said the american has a problem with her right shoulder. it comes as a blow to the women s draw as last year s champion  justin henin-hardenne  and runner-up  kim clijsters  will also be absent. capriati is a two-time champion in melbourne with wins in 2001 and 2002. she is believed to have picked up the injury at the advanta championships at philadelphia in november and had to pull out of an exhibition match with wimbledon champion maria sharapova on 17 december. capriati also decided against competing in the australian open warm-up event  the sydney international.

pountney handed ban and fine northampton coach budge pountney has been fined Â£2 000 and banned from match-day coaching for six weeks for calling a referee  a disgrace .  pountney was found guilty of bringing the game into disrepute at a rugby football union disciplinary hearing in london on thursday night. pountney criticised referee steve lander s performance in northampton s defeat by saracens on 5 february. the last two weeks of the six-week ban are suspended. pountney pleaded guilty to the offence before a panel consisting of chairman robert horner  nigel gillingham and jeff probyn. the ban means former scotland international pountney cannot enter the playing enclosure  technical areas or go near the touchline  tunnel or players and officials  areas on the day of a game.

johnson too strong for gb runners britain s kathy butler and hayley yelling were no match for benita johnson in the 51st cross international zornotza in amorebieta  spain.  butler and yelling finished fourth and fifth as australian world champion johnson romped to a five-second victory in the 6km race ahead of edith masai. masai s fellow kenyan alice timbilil finished third. johnson said:  i ran comfortably for the first 3km and then i tried to leave the others but it wasn t an easy task.  butler clocked a time of 22 minutes 45 seconds - 22secs behind the winner but four ahead of yelling  who last month succeeded paula radcliffe as european champion. johnson  will be one of the star attractions at the great edinburghinternational cross country on 15 january.

koubek suspended after drugs test stefan koubek says he has been banned for three months by the international tennis federation (itf) after testing positive for a banned substance.  the world number 60 failed a routine drugs test at this year s french open but now plans to lodge an appeal. koubek believes an injection given to him by an austrian doctor to treat a wrist injury is to blame for producing traces of the substance in his system.  i have acted correctly   the 27-year-old austrian said in a statement. koubek  who defeated britain s greg rusedski in the decisive rubber of the davis cup in september  is now set to miss the start of the season. he said   a three-month ban would mean that i not only will miss the australian open  but also the davis cup in australia.

capriati out of australian open jennifer capriati has become the third leading lady to withdraw from the australian open because of injury.  the organisers of the first grand slam of 2005  which begins on 17 january  said the american has a problem with her right shoulder. it comes as a blow to the women s draw as last year s champion  justin henin-hardenne  and runner-up  kim clijsters  will also be absent. capriati is a two-time champion in melbourne with wins in 2001 and 2002. she is believed to have picked up the injury at the advanta championships at philadelphia in november and had to pull out of an exhibition match with wimbledon champion maria sharapova on 17 december. capriati also decided against competing in the australian open warm-up event  the sydney international.

capriati of the open Australian jennifer capriati became the third main lady to withdraw from the open Australian due to injury. the organizers of the first great slam of 2005 which starts on January 17th declared that the American has a problem with her right shoulder. he comes like a blow to the draw of lots of women as the champion of last year Justin henin-hardenne and kim clijsters will also be absent. capriati is twice champion in melbourne with victories in 2001 and 2002. it is believed that she took the injury at the advanta championships in Philadellphia in November and had to leave an exhibition match with wimbledon champion maria sharapova on December 17. capriati also decided not to participate in the open Australian-up international sydney event.

pountney handed ban and fine northampton coach budge pountney has been fined Â£2 000 and banned from match-day coaching for six weeks for calling a referee  a disgrace .  pountney was found guilty of bringing the game into disrepute at a rugby football union disciplinary hearing in london on thursday night. pountney criticised referee steve lander s performance in northampton s defeat by saracens on 5 february. the last two weeks of the six-week ban are suspended. pountney pleaded guilty to the offence before a panel consisting of chairman robert horner  nigel gillingham and jeff probyn. the ban means former scotland international pountney cannot enter the playing enclosure  technical areas or go near the touchline  tunnel or players and officials  areas on the day of a game.

johnson too strong for gb runners britain s kathy butler and hayley yelling were no match for benita johnson in the 51st cross international zornotza in amorebieta  spain.  butler and yelling finished fourth and fifth as australian world champion johnson romped to a five-second victory in the 6km race ahead of edith masai. masai s fellow kenyan alice timbilil finished third. johnson said:  i ran comfortably for the first 3km and then i tried to leave the others but it wasn t an easy task.  butler clocked a time of 22 minutes 45 seconds - 22secs behind the winner but four ahead of yelling  who last month succeeded paula radcliffe as european champion. johnson  will be one of the star attractions at the great edinburghinternational cross country on 15 january.

tottenham bid £8m for forest duo nottingham forest have confirmed they have received an Â£8m bid from tottenham for andy reid and michael dawson.  reid rejected a move to southampton after forest accepted a cash-plus-players offer while spurs had made previous bids for the 22-year-old. spurs had also made an undisclosed offer for 21-year-old defender dawson. forest chief executive mark arthur said:  we ve received an Â£8m bid from spurs for the two players and we re considering the offer.  southampton s offer for republic of ireland international reid comprised Â£3m-plus and two players - brett ormerod and darren kenton.  spurs had seen previous bids of Â£3m  Â£4m and Â£5m for reid rejected by the championship club.

newcastle line up babayaro newcastle manager graeme souness is closing in on signing chelsea defender celestine babayaro when the transfer window reopens.  souness is bidding to bolster his defence and  according to reports  contract negotiations are at an advanced stage with the player. babayaro has been in the premiership since 1997 when he moved to chelsea for Â£2.25m from anderlecht. but the 26-year-old has been surplus to requirements this season. souness would not be drawn on specifics over individual players.  but he said:  all i can tell you is that the chairman has worked really hard in the last couple of months to try to do deals.  we have said from day one we want to strengthen  and that is what we are hoping to do in the coming weeks.

spurs to sign iceland u21 star tottenham are primed to snap up iceland under-21 international emil hallfredsson after he impressed on trial at white hart lane.  the 20-year-old midfielder  who plays for fh hafnarfjordur  also starred in the uefa cup match against scottish side dunfermline earlier this season. spurs have agreed a fee for the player  who has yet to agree personal terms.  he had offers from two other clubs but he decided to come to tottenham   said spurs sporting director frank arnesen.  he is a left-sided player  a position we have been looking at and he showed so much talent in his time here that we decided to take him.  it s down the road of bringing in talent  good prospects and giving them a place at tottenham where they can improve.

blunkett hints at election call ex-home secretary david blunkett has given fresh clues that the general election will be announced on monday.  he told bbc radio five live:  i m out in my constituency getting ready for what we presume will be an announcement very shortly at the weekend.  he clarified that he meant he would be in his sheffield seat this weekend  not that he expected an election call then. tony blair is tipped to ask the queen on monday to dissolve parliament ready for a 5 may poll.

blunkett gave new clues that the general election will be announced on Monday. he told bbc radio five live: I'm in my constituency preparing for what we assume will be an announcement very soon on the weekend. he said he wanted to say that he would be in his headquarters in Sheffield this weekend not that he expected an election call then. tony bair is advised to ask the queen on Monday to dissolve the parliament ready for a May 5 ballot.

johnson too strong for gb runners britain s kathy butler and hayley yelling were no match for benita johnson in the 51st cross international zornotza in amorebieta  spain.  butler and yelling finished fourth and fifth as australian world champion johnson romped to a five-second victory in the 6km race ahead of edith masai. masai s fellow kenyan alice timbilil finished third. johnson said:  i ran comfortably for the first 3km and then i tried to leave the others but it wasn t an easy task.  butler clocked a time of 22 minutes 45 seconds - 22secs behind the winner but four ahead of yelling  who last month succeeded paula radcliffe as european champion. johnson  will be one of the star attractions at the great edinburghinternational cross country on 15 january.

Johnson too strong for runners gb brita s kathy butler and screaming hayley were not the match for benita johnson in the 51st international race zornotza in amorebieta spain. Majorer and screaming finished fourth and fifth as Australian world champion johnson jumped to a five-second win in the 6km race ahead of Edith masai. masai his colleague kenyan alice timbil finished third. Johnson said: I ran comfortably for the first 3 km and then I tried to leave the others but it was not an easy task. Majorer took a time of 22 minutes 45 seconds - 22 seconds behind the winner but four seconds before yelling who succeeded last month paula radcliffe as European champion. Johnson will be one of the star attractions in the big country Edinburghinternational cross on January 15th.

koubek suspended after drugs test stefan koubek says he has been banned for three months by the international tennis federation (itf) after testing positive for a banned substance.  the world number 60 failed a routine drugs test at this year s french open but now plans to lodge an appeal. koubek believes an injection given to him by an austrian doctor to treat a wrist injury is to blame for producing traces of the substance in his system.  i have acted correctly   the 27-year-old austrian said in a statement. koubek  who defeated britain s greg rusedski in the decisive rubber of the davis cup in september  is now set to miss the start of the season. he said   a three-month ban would mean that i not only will miss the australian open  but also the davis cup in australia.

Koubek believes that an injection given to him by an Austrian doctor to treat a wrist injury is to blame for having produced traces of the substance in his system. I acted correctly the 27-year-old austrien said in a statement. Koubek who defeated Britain s Greg rusedski in the decisive rubber of the cup of dis advice in September is now about to miss the beginning of the season. he said that a ban of three months would mean that I would miss not only the Australian opening but also the cup of dissertation enstralie.

ivanovic seals canberra victory serbia s ana ivanovic captured her first wta title with a straight-sets victory over hungarian melinda czink in the final of the canberra classic.  the 17-year-old took 83 minutes to take the match 7-5 6-1. ivanovic beat czink in the last round of qualifying but the hungarian made the main draw as a lucky loser after katarina srebotnik withdrew injured. ivanovic said:  i was really nervous in the beginning  but i pulled through and didn t do too much wrong.  a junior wimbledon finalist last year  she added:  it s my first wta title  and to win it has really given me more energy to practice and improve.  ivanovic will play 32nd seed iveta benesova of the czech republic in the first round.said of the australian open in melbourne.

ivanovic seal canberra victory serbia s ana ivanovic captured his first wta title with a direct victory over the Hungarian melinda czink in the final of the classic canberra. the 17-year-old took 83 minutes to take the game 7-5 6-1. ivanovic beat czink in the last qualifying round but the Hungarian made the main draw as a lucky loser after katarina srebotnik withdrew injured. ivanovic said: I was really nervous at first but I pulled through and didn't hurt too much. a junior finalist wimbledon last year she added: this is my first wta title and winning it really gave me more energy to practice and improve. ivanovic will play 32nd see iveta benesova of the Czech Republic in the first round.Said of the Australian opened in melbourne.

beattie return calms attack fears everton striker james beattie has been declared fit for training on tuesday  despite suffering an alleged assault last saturday.  beattie  27  is not believed to be as seriously hurt as some reports have suggested after being  the victim of an unprovoked assault  in birmingham. he was on a night out with his girlfriend and two friends following everton s 3-1 win over aston villa.  he was shaken but not badly injured   said everton spokesman ian ross. he added:  he did speak to the police but will not be pressing charges.  he has spoken to manager david moyes about what happened.  beattie was suspended for the win at aston villa after his red card against chelsea and he will be available again for the merseyside derby at liverpool on 20 march.

Beattie return calm the attack fears Everton attacking james Beattie was declared fit for training on Tuesday despite the suffering of an alleged assault last Saturday. beattie 27 is not believed to be as seriously injured as some reports suggested after being the victim of an unprovoked assault in Birmingham. he was on one night with his girlfriend and two friends after Everton s 3-1 victory over the villa in Aston. he was shaken but not seriously injured said Everton spokesman ian ross. he added: he spoke to the police but will not file a complaint. he spoke to manager David Moyes about what happened. beattie was suspended for the victory at Aston villa after his red card against chelsea and he will be available again for the merseyside derby liver on March 20.
